did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: The Jamaican Creole tape recordings is a collection of songs, stories and interviews recorded by the American linguist David DeCamp from 1957-1959. These recordings document DeCamp's research interests in the Pidgins and Creoles of Jamaica and British Honduras.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the original reel-to-reel audiotapes is restricted pending the creation of use copies.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jamaican Creole tape recordings, 1957-1959. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: The collection consist of four reel-to-reel audiotapes

did.unittitle: Jamaica. Farewell party at Bermuda Mount, given for the DeCamps by the people of Irish Town (cont'd on reel #40)1958 Aug 27
did.physdesc: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape.

did.unittitle: Jamaica. Track 1. Farewell party for the DeCamps, given by the people of Irish Town at Bermuda Mount (songs, speeches, toasts, pocomania, etc.) [Track] 2. Interview with info. 56, Kingston, on subject of the Ras Tafari movement, Dec. 16, 19581958 Dec 16
did.physdesc: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape.

did.unittitle: Jamaica. Moorant Bay Kumina (Seaga) Drumming and singing by a Kumina band from Morant Bay.1959 Aug 24
did.physdesc: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape.

did.unittitle: Jamaica & British Honduras. Track 1. Songs and stories from Green Island, Port Antonio, and Priory, St. Anns (Jamaica). [Track] 2. Song from Briish Honduras. [Track] 3. Mr. Felix speaks about logging in British Honduras. (#2 & 3 dubbed in 1957 from recordings made by A.L. Ayuso, R.B. LaPage, and MacEdward Leach.)1957
did.physdesc: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape.
